column4: So, does anyone know how to make the latest wubi use the iso file I've already downloaded? The wiki says to just place it in the same dir as the wubi installer, but that's blatantly not working.
Screw it just gonna hack the wubi source if that's what it'll take...
why on earth would you do that?

because it's not behaving how it should. It's supposed to use the iso file in the same directory as itself when present, it isn't. Rather than doing so it's attempting to download the .torrent file (which presumably is < 200kB) which takes almost an hour, then it attempts to download the .iso which takes so long I gave up after 2 days.
have you considered partitioning your drive and doing a normal install?... something scares me about "hcaking" wubi.
that's not possible, if it was I would. This machine has no CD drive and I don't own a USB drive to install from.
honestly, wubi is a big enough train wreck as it is.. you're goign down a slip slope w/ your current plan, but i wish you luck.. i sure wouldn't do it
meh, I'm literally only going to change the code which downloads the files so it doesn't, and just installs from the files that I'll have placed there.
surely it can't be that bad of a trainwreck that that'd be a big deal
i understand that.. but like i said... wubi has enough potential for damage.. I wouldn't go trying to make it worse
lol.. hang out here for a few days and watch the folks with wubi/unable to boot probs.
i guess my point is, if you're gonna do it, do it right
well, I'm not going to touch that code... but if I get that problem I suppose I'll be forced to buy a USB drive lol.
now all I have to do is actually find the source code in the first place... *sigh*
you know 1gig thumb drives can be had for about $8-$10 US.. right?
for a guy living on unemployment social security that's a lot of money
got a friend you can borrow one from?
